data.name: Word Value Madness
data.description:
For this challenge you will take any string and return its "Word Value Madness" (WVM) value.  This is calculated by summing up the numerical values of each character in the string.  

The numerical values are as follows:

Each vowel (a, e, i, o , u) = -7

Each consonant = 3

Each number = its own value

Each symbol = 1

Each space = 0

Therefore, the WVM value of the string "I have 8 cats and 6 dogs!" would be 3 because:

vowels = (I+a+e+a+a+o) = ((-7)+(-7)+(-7)+(-7)+(-7)+(-7)) = -42

consonants = (h+v+c+t+s+n+d+d+g+s) = (3+3+3+3+3+3+3+3+3+3+3) = 30

numbers = (8+6) = 14

special characters = (!) = 1

Total = -42 + 30 + 14 + 1 = 3

Note: Expect strings to have upper and lowercase characters.
